questions.question_text: An engineer needs to configure the infrastructure for wireless clients to use IEEE 802.1X to the onboarding VLAN. After authentication and profiling, it must be determined if the client is a company device that is up-to-date. After this step, the device must connect to the corporate VLAN and access all resources. What must be implemented to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Change of Authorization (CoA): This feature allows the network to dynamically change the authorization parameters for a client after the initial authentication. In this scenario:

The client initially connects to the onboarding VLAN using IEEE 802.1X authentication.

After authentication and profiling, the system determines if the client is a company device and whether it is up-to-date.

If the client meets the criteria, a CoA request is sent to the network device (e.g., the WLC or switch) to reassign the client to the corporate VLAN, granting access to all resources.

Selected Answer: C
To meet the specified requirements, the engineer needs to implement a process that involves changing the client's authorization after authentication and profiling. Therefore, the correct choice is:

C. Change of Authorization

The process involves initially onboarding the client to a specific VLAN using IEEE 802.1X authentication. After successful authentication and profiling, the next step is to determine whether the client is a company device that is up-to-date. Once this determination is made, the client's authorization is changed to allow it to connect to the corporate VLAN and access all resources.

choices.A: Configure all access switches to be managed by Cisco DNA Center.
choices.B: Allow SNMPv3 between Cisco DNA Center and access switches.
choices.D: Disable all the DCA channels under RRM on the WLC.
choices.C: Connect APs to the network using a trunk port with native VLAN.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To enable Cisco DNA Center to classify "Rogue on Wire" APs in a Cisco SD-Access environment where all SSIDs are Fabric-enabled, the customer must take the following action:

A. Configure all access switches to be managed by Cisco DNA Center.

Explanation:
Rogue on Wire APs: These are unauthorized access points connected to the wired network. To detect and classify them, Cisco DNA Center needs visibility into the network infrastructure, including the access switches.

Managed Access Switches: By configuring all access switches to be managed by Cisco DNA Center, the system can monitor and analyze network traffic, detect rogue devices, and take appropriate actions.

Selected Answer: A
To classify "Rogue on Wire" APs in a Cisco SD-Access environment managed by Cisco DNA Center, all access switches need to be managed by Cisco DNA Center. This allows Cisco DNA Center to monitor the network for rogue access points effectively. When access switches are managed by Cisco DNA Center, it can detect unauthorized APs that are connected to the wired network and classify them as "Rogue on Wire." This integration is crucial for proper rogue detection and classification in a Cisco SD-Access environment.

questions.question_text: A customer recently upgraded the network to Cisco SD-Access. Cisco DNA Center manages the wireless network; all SSIDs are Fabric-enabled. Cisco DNA Center must be able to classify â€œRogue on Wire" APs. Which action must the customer take?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
802.11 b/g operates in the 2.4 GHz band, which has 11 channels in total. However, only 3 non-overlapping channels (1, 6, and 11) are available in this band due to channel overlap issues.

Using these 3 non-overlapping channels ensures maximum coverage and minimizes interference, which is critical for effectively monitoring and tracking RFID tags.

Using fewer than 3 channels would reduce coverage, while using more than 3 would cause interference and degrade performance.

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C

Selected Answer: C
To optimize the monitoring and location calculation of RFID tags, you can enable tracking optimization on
up to four channels within the 2.4-GHz band of an 802.11b/g access point radio. This feature allows you to
scan only the channels on which tags are usually programmed to operate (such as channels 1, 6, and 11).

Selected Answer: B
B. Would it not be 3 for 802.11b . The image shows channel 11 configured which is for a 3 channel non-overlapping config.

Selected Answer: C
To optimize the monitoring and location calculation of RFID tags, you can enable tracking optimization on up to four channels within the 2.4-GHz band of an 802.11b/g access point radio. This feature allows you to scan only the channels on which tags are usually programmed to operate (such as channels 1, 6, and 11).
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/7-4/configuration/guides/consolidated/b_cg74_CONSOLIDATED/m_optimizing_rfid_tracking_on_access_points.pdf

Selected Answer: B
802.11 b/g wireless networks operate in the 2.4 GHz frequency band and typically use channels 1 through 11 in North America. Each channel in the 2.4 GHz band has a width of 20 MHz.

To maximize the optimization of monitoring and tracking RFID tags, it's best to use multiple channels to avoid interference and congestion. The channels should be selected such that they are non-overlapping to minimize interference among neighboring channels.

Channels 1, 6, and 11 are considered non-overlapping channels in the 2.4 GHz band. Therefore, to maximize optimization and minimize interference, the optimal choice is:

B. 3 channels

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An enterprise uses 802.11 b/g APs and must track the RFID tags within the network. How many channels must be used to maximize the optimization of the monitoring and tracking of the tags?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
WMF (Wireless Multicast Forwarding): This protocol allows multicast traffic to be forwarded only to specific WLANs that are configured to support it. It ensures that multicast traffic is sent only to the intended WLAN (in this case, MULTI123456789) and not broadcast across the entire network, which improves efficiency and reduces unnecessary traffic.

Selected Answer: A
A. WMF is to forward multicast traffic to specific hosts. WMM is enabled per VLAN, so I think it should be A.

questions.question_text: Which protocol enables multicast traffic only on a specific WLAN named MULTI123456789 instead of the whole network?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
In a FlexConnect deployment where access points (APs) are configured with centrally-switched SSIDs, the Trust DSCP QoS configuration must be implemented to maintain consistent QoS markings across the wired and wireless network. Hereâ€™s why:

Trust DSCP:
DSCP (Differentiated Services Code Point) is a Layer 3 QoS marking that provides end-to-end traffic prioritization. By configuring the Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) and APs to trust DSCP, the QoS markings in the IP headers of packets are preserved as traffic traverses both the wired and wireless network. This ensures consistent QoS treatment for applications like voice (VoWiFi) and data.

Centrally-Switched SSIDs:
In centrally-switched mode, traffic from the APs is tunneled back to the WLC. Trusting DSCP ensures that the QoS markings are maintained as traffic passes through the WLC and into the wired network.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

D. Trust DSCP. Question is not asking what markings will be applied but what will allow whatever marking there is to exist and be maintained throughout it's journey over both the wired and wireless infrastructure.

Selected Answer: A
If WLAN QoS is default (Silver), the class of service will be rewritten to Best Effort on the controller.
WMM is WiFi Multimedia Qos, the question was which feature provides for wireless and WIRED. Provided answer is correct and verified.
Answer should be C - Allow WMM.

questions.question_text: A corporation has a wireless network where all access points are configured in FlexConnect. The WLC has a Data WLAN and a VoWiFi WLAN implemented where centrally-switched SSID is configured for the APs. Which QoS configuration must be implemented for the wireless packets to maintain the marking across the wired and wireless network?
